title: WHAT IS FADI HIDING?
text:
George Michael’s ex Kenny Goss desperately tried to save tragic singer’s life in lead up to his death, reports claim 
One friend of the Careless Whisper star said: “Fadi was a leech from the beginning. 
“George realised this but I think he deliberately ignored it. He was grateful of the company. George relied on Fadi for many things. 
“But they had been estranged for 18 months. RELATED STORIES Robbie Williams pays touching tribute to George Michael by performing Freedom at NYE show FAMILY DREAM George Michael 'dreamed of being a father and planned to adopt in 2017', reports claim sales surge George Michael makes a huge chart comeback days after his death as his music dominates the festive rundown I'M YOUR MAN 1963-2016 George Michael remembered from his childhood through to WHAM! and his battle with drug addiction TONY PARSONS George's mum kept him stable... when she died, he embraced the dark CLIMB YOUR MAN George Michael’s neighbour Kate Moss reveals she had a secret route into his garden to use pool 
“Within hours of discovering his body , posts appeared on his Twitter account, and then within 12 hours he sold his story. Does this sound like a grieving partner?” 
It was reported that cops are to interview Fadi over fears the star’s death was drug-related. There is no suggestion he has done anything wrong. 
Fadi, who had been with George since 2009 , claimed he spent all weekend at the star’s home in Goring-on-Thames, Oxon. 
But he now says they spent the night before George died apart, insisting: “I fell asleep in my car and I never saw him that night.” Twitter Fadi left these posts on his Twitter but then later claimed his account was hacked Splash News Fadi now insists he and George spent the night before apart and that he slept outside in his car George Michael gives Oprah Winfrey viewer a tour of his country home 
A tweet from Fadi’s account read: “The only thing George wanted is to DIE. He tried to kill himself many times...” Another added: “And finally he managed.” 
The account was then deleted. Fadi said: “My account has been hacked and closed. I did not send the tweets.” 
Asked about reports George was on heroin, Fadi replied: “No way.” Police are treating George’s death as “unexplained”. A post mortem proved inconclusive.
